definitions.definition: A person who fishes with a hook and line .
examples: A throng of anglers lined the trout stream on opening day of trout season.
The angler lured a smaller fish into reach with the appendage on its head.

definitions.definition: Someone who tries to work an angle ; a person who schemes or has an ulterior motive .
examples: Jonas was a consummate angler when it came the company's leave policy; he had it figured so he only needed to work six months out of the year.

definitions.definition: A thief who uses a hooked stick to steal goods out of shop-windows, grates, etc.

main_definition: A person who fishes with a hook and line .
secondary_definitions: Someone who tries to work an angle ; a person who schemes or has an ulterior motive .
( archaic , UK , thieves' cant ) A thief who uses a hooked stick to steal goods out of shop-windows, grates, etc.
